FuncDef: The reset saved-configuration command clears information about the configuration files on the storage device. The reset saved-configuration command clears information about the configuration files on the storage device.
Examples: The configuration will be erased to reconfigure.Continue? [Y/N]:n
The configuration will be erased to reconfigure.Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
After the device software is upgraded, the configuration file in the storage medium may not match the new software version. In this case, you can run the reset saved-configuration command to clear the old configuration file.
If the device in use applies to another scenario and the original configuration file of the device does not meet requirements in the scenario, you can run the reset saved-configuration command to clear the existing configuration file and set a new configuration file.
